title: Bug 7785 - SaveAs Forgets the file type
description: The icon has also changed from the parent javafile icon to a generic file icon.
OB:
1) Open an existing java file.
2) Modify the file, e.g., move an existing class.
3) Click the SaveAs icon next to the Save Icon. A dialog will appear.
4) Browse for a valid container location.
5) Type the filename but ignore the extension, which is not requested.
6) Click OK.

Observe that the Navigator has added the file to the specified location, but the file extension is not shown.
EB:
The file is now saved without a specific extension and is treated as a generic file. When opened, the file is displayed as plain text.

Expected Behavior:
The file should be saved with the same extension as the original file unless explicitly changed.
SR:
1) Open an existing java file.
2) Modify the file.
3) Click the SaveAs icon next to the Save Icon.
4) In the dialog that appears, browse for a valid container location.
5) Type the filename without the extension.
6) Click OK.

Expected Result:
The file is saved with the same extension as the original file, unless the extension is explicitly changed during the SaveAs process.
